text:
[Starter]: Do you have any pets? How long have you had them, and what do you like most about them?
[Student]: Tell me something
[Teacher]: interesting about your pet! I'm happy to chat about my furry friends! I have two cats, Luna and Leo, and a dog, Max. I've had Luna and Leo since they were kittens, so about 7 years now. They're both British Shorthairs, and they're so laid-back and affectionate. I love how they always know how to make me smile, even on my worst days.  Max, on the other hand, is a rescue dog that I adopted about

[Teacher]: met while visiting him in Europe.  I'm sure you're curious about how I ended up with these pets in the, um, what would you call, 2023?  But I think you'll find that these two dogs and cat have helped me recover from the shock of my 2020 COVID-19 diagnosis.  They've been my constant companions during these difficult times.  Max, the dog, has also been very helpful in my therapy.  He's very calm and gentle

text:
[Starter]: Do you have any hobbies you like to spend time on? How did you get into them, and what keeps you interested?
[Student]: I had a talk with the girls last summer who wanted me to take over as teacher in their classes because there was nothing else for me to do but just play games
[Teacher]: with the girls, so they said I'm an expert in games. I'm glad to say that, and I believe they had a good reason for saying that. As for me, my favorite hobby is playing chess, and I'm currently working on improving my skills. I started playing chess when I was about 10 years old and my parents bought me a chess set. My dad was a huge chess fan and introduced me to the game, teaching me the basics and basic strategies. Over the years
[Student]: Ive been doing a lot of hard work at it all by myself now and Ill never be able to beat back those people that werent listening to us today in school before
[Teacher]: , but I have to get better because I want to play against those guys and show them that I can do the job. This is not a game anymore. I need to get better and be better, and I need to do it fast. I feel like Im being put under a lot of pressure to perform and to be a good teacher, and I feel like I have to work a lot harder to live up to my responsibilities. text:

[Student]: How can we thank you for that little Christmas party I invited the other night on my birthday No one asked me to come
[Teacher]: . I wanted to host a little Christmas party for my family and friends. We have a big tree, a fireplace, and a lot of decorations. The atmosphere is cozy and intimate. I'm really looking forward to spending quality time with my loved ones.   I know you can't attend, but I wanted to share my enthusiasm with you.
